page.title: 14SOCIAL MEDICINE IN FAIR OAK
page.content: Much specialist advice and help is given at the Stoke Wood Surgery. Home visits are made by 4 health visitors,2 midwives and 2 district nurses. Family planning advice,psychiatric help,general health advice as well as acupuncture are available. Informal chats about problems are readily offered. All records are computer recorded so an efficient monitoring system ensures that patients are made aware of any treatment, e.g.vaccinations that is due. The area being largely agricultural there is an especially high tetanus rate. As Fair Oak is an expanding area there is a predominance of young patients. The Surgery currently treats 1300 patients under 5 years. It also has1046 patients aged between 65 and 74.
